text.text_translated:
One night in 2003, Suzanne Collins watched TV.
She changed channels again and again.
It was during a war.
The US army went into Iraq then.
She saw TV shows with young people.
They tried to win one million dollars.
She also saw news about the war.
In her mind, the two things mixed.
It felt very wrong to her.
Then she got the idea for The Hunger Games.
The Hunger Games is the name of that idea.

feedback.feedback: FAIL: A2 Vocabulary Violation. The text contains the B1 word "Hunger" in the title "The Hunger Games". A2 level vocabulary does not include the word "hunger". To correct this, replace or define the term at A2 level. Suggestion: Change the title reference to a simpler phrase or add a simple explanation for "hunger" such as "feeling very hungry".

best_attempt.text_translated:
One night in 2003, Suzanne Collins watched TV.
She changed channels again and again.
It was during a war.
The US army went into Iraq then.
She saw TV shows with young people.
They tried to win one million dollars.
She also saw news about the war.
In her mind, the two things mixed.
It felt very wrong to her.
Then she got the idea for The Hunger Games.
The Hunger Games is the name of that idea.
